componenttext: The guidance last quarter, negative 3 to 5 for this period, it's the same like you started out pretty negative, I guess, maybe at the low end of that range. Granted negative 4 is not that much of an improvement, just curious if things did get a little bit great better or they're variable throughout the quarter and realize in the context of negative 3 5 for the rest of the year, doesn't it sound like much improvement but curious if you can talk about if Northeast at least has gotten a little better post the end of the quarter.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good morning, Simeon. First of all, if you step back and look at our performance over the last 40 weeks, it's in the down 3 range. So when you look at going forward, I would say we are conservative with the down 3 to down 5. We finished better than we sta
componenttext: Good morning, Simeon. First of all, if you step back and look at our performance over the last 40 weeks, it's in the down 3 range. So when you look at going forward, I would say we are conservative with the down 3 to down 5. We finished better than we started but we're still working through a lot of things inside the company. We swipe the P&L every Monday. We look at execution metrics that matter. We're making some progress on those metrics. So clearly, I'm feeling like some of those things are moving in the right direction, but at the moment, we feel it's important to be conservative with that guidance at the moment and that's where we are.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: So my follow-up is, it sounds like the business is still [indiscernible] the price or just suffering from some of the integration things that have happened over the past year. I know a year ago, we talked about the business might be at its maximum pain po
componenttext: So my follow-up is, it sounds like the business is still [indiscernible] the price or just suffering from some of the integration things that have happened over the past year. I know a year ago, we talked about the business might be at its maximum pain point and granted you weren't there at that time and there's a lot of change. But I'm curious why if there are fixes that were made to, let's say, address some of these issues why things are getting worse. Could it be a sign that our customers giving up on the business or it's just going to take a lot longer for you to dig out some of these setbacks?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I mean there's obviously a lot to your question. I mean we're building a strategy that we feel can win over the long term. That strategy is going to incorporate the work that we had done on the integration. So it's a very comprehensive business stra
componenttext: Well, I mean there's obviously a lot to your question. I mean we're building a strategy that we feel can win over the long term. That strategy is going to incorporate the work that we had done on the integration. So it's a very comprehensive business strategy that span the growth and agenda, has a very robust productivity agenda. It's going to align the people and culture behind the business strategy. So we're building that strategy out. I think the performance that we've had so far is reflective of a strategy that really hasn't been as comprehensive and holistic as the one we're going to have going forward. And the execution against that strategy was not where it needs to be candidly. So we're confident that we have a strategy going forward, but where we are now is we're still trying to address some of the fixes from the previous approach.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Seth Sigman with Crédit Suisse.
componenttext: The next question is from Seth Sigman with Crédit Suisse.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: My main question relates to the store and consolidation strategy. The consolidation of CARQUEST, it went from a benefit to a negative in the quarter. Can you elaborate on what changed with the strategy and why that reversed? And if there's a way to quanti
componenttext: My main question relates to the store and consolidation strategy. The consolidation of CARQUEST, it went from a benefit to a negative in the quarter. Can you elaborate on what changed with the strategy and why that reversed? And if there's a way to quantify how much of a negative that was to the quarter, that would be helpful.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, the consolidation programs themselves, the CCR itself, we've taken a step back, Seth, from those and we're looking at what elements of the CCR initiative actually worked in our favor and which ones were not necessarily lined up behind the original e
componenttext: Well, the consolidation programs themselves, the CCR itself, we've taken a step back, Seth, from those and we're looking at what elements of the CCR initiative actually worked in our favor and which ones were not necessarily lined up behind the original estimates that were done, and we have pluses and minuses there. Consolidations, we didn't really hit the goals that we set for ourselves on consolidations, so we have stepped back on that one and we have reduced the number of consolidations that we have going forward. Other aspects of the CCR strategy have worked better than we anticipated and we're accelerating those. So we're looking very carefully at that and that'll be folded into the broader strategy going forward.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then Mike, you had mentioned some investments in service and availability planned for later this year. Can you elaborate on that and maybe help quantify it?
componenttext: And then Mike, you had mentioned some investments in service and availability planned for later this year. Can you elaborate on that and maybe help quantify it?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. We're looking at the fourth quarter, Seth, in terms of how do we make sure we ramp up the top line. We really need more growth. As you saw in the quarter, the deleverage was the single biggest driver of our profit shortfall, and obviously, we're focu
componenttext: Yes. We're looking at the fourth quarter, Seth, in terms of how do we make sure we ramp up the top line. We really need more growth. As you saw in the quarter, the deleverage was the single biggest driver of our profit shortfall, and obviously, we're focused on retaining momentum of the top line. And with our customers, we're making very selective investments in how we drive the top line and that spans across multiple different lines. I'm not going to get into specifics, but we feel really good about our ability to stimulate more growth in the fourth quarter.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from Matt Fassler with Goldman Sachs.
componenttext: Our next question comes from Matt Fassler with Goldman Sachs.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: My first question relates to daily replenishment, and it seems like the execution of that strategy was a big challenge for you during the quarter both sales-wise and cost-wise. Can you try to dimensionalize for us any impact, how many stores or percentage
componenttext: My first question relates to daily replenishment, and it seems like the execution of that strategy was a big challenge for you during the quarter both sales-wise and cost-wise. Can you try to dimensionalize for us any impact, how many stores or percentage of the chain made that shift? What kind of dollar excess of the distribution side did you -- on the distribution cost side that is, did you see as a result of this process not going quite the way you wanted?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, well obviously, Matt, our customers trust us to have the right part at the right time, and that means making sure we're delivering high-quality, great value parts accurately, reliably and consistently and when they need them. So that's the goal. Our
componenttext: Yes, well obviously, Matt, our customers trust us to have the right part at the right time, and that means making sure we're delivering high-quality, great value parts accurately, reliably and consistently and when they need them. So that's the goal. Our customers really don't care how we get them the part as long as we get them the part when they need it, and that's an important learning we've had. Replenishment delivery frequency to the stores is just one element of the supply chain. It's not the goal itself. So we're really looking carefully at our entire supply chain and how to provide the absolute best solution for each store and its customers. We're making sure that every aspect, whether it's the fill rate from our DCs, the quality of our assortment in the market, the order accuracy, the consistency and speed of our delivery throughout the supply chain are improved. And we had some markets, as you referenced, where we moved a little bit too quickly to a solution that didn't make sense for those markets at that time and it did impact our profit culture in the quarter. We've addressed that immediately. In fact, we're beginning to see some progress already from the actions that we've taken in those markets. I'm not going to get into specifics on the number or stores or DCs, but they were in the Northeast and Midwest and we've taken the appropriate actions there.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's great. And my follow-up question relates to customer relationships. I think there was a question that alluded to this earlier and we're getting a lot of questions on it, as it's concerned about the permanence of potential share loss given the stick
componenttext: That's great. And my follow-up question relates to customer relationships. I think there was a question that alluded to this earlier and we're getting a lot of questions on it, as it's concerned about the permanence of potential share loss given the stickiness of commercial relationships. Is there any way to quantify customer satisfaction, customer losses, obviously, from the some stores sales under pressure. Is that reduction in sales per customer? Is that a reduction in customer count on the commercial side? If we could just give us a sense as to the decomposing of that sales decline on the commercial side and thinking about how easy it is to win some of that business back or not.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I've been around customers for 35 years, and I can tell you that it's a very dynamic situation with customers. You're either getting better with those relationships or you're getting worse and I can tell you, we're going to get better. We put Bob Cu
componenttext: Well, I've been around customers for 35 years, and I can tell you that it's a very dynamic situation with customers. You're either getting better with those relationships or you're getting worse and I can tell you, we're going to get better. We put Bob Cushing into that big role today, overseeing all the commercial. He is maniacally focused on customer service and getting the right product to the right place at the right time. I have tremendous confidence that we will build those relationships back. We are focused on all aspects of the customer agenda, how many customers we're picking up, how many we're losing, whether we're gaining share inside each customer. So all of those aspects are being considered at the moment. And we do have to build the execution muscle inside of Advance such that we make progress against that. I am pretty confident that with Bob's appointment we're going to really start to make material changes on that.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Chris Bottiglieri with Wolfe Research.
componenttext: Our next question is from Chris Bottiglieri with Wolfe Research.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Quick question on the distribution strategy. A while back, you'd alluded to some mega hubs that you were introducing. Just trying to figure out where that kind of fits into your strategy going forward as preliminary results may have seen how those may dif
componenttext: Quick question on the distribution strategy. A while back, you'd alluded to some mega hubs that you were introducing. Just trying to figure out where that kind of fits into your strategy going forward as preliminary results may have seen how those may differ from the PDQ [ph] facilities you've used in the past.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we're really stepping back, Chris, on the supply chain in total. We want to look at every aspect of it. We're working through this transition. As Bob comes into commercial, we want to make sure that we're focused on the right metrics. So I mean ever
componenttext: Well, we're really stepping back, Chris, on the supply chain in total. We want to look at every aspect of it. We're working through this transition. As Bob comes into commercial, we want to make sure that we're focused on the right metrics. So I mean everything is on the table in terms of how we process the supply chain. We need to transform it and make it much more customer-friendly so that we're delivering the part when the customer needs it. So you'll hear more about that in the fall, but it's really more of a holistic approach to the supply chain than we've had in the past.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, then one brief follow-up kind of related. You seem very metric-driven accountability-focused. Can you talk about how that kind of fits in the compensation plans? Like the previous team have alluded to test in certain markets [indiscernible] the comp
componenttext: Okay, then one brief follow-up kind of related. You seem very metric-driven accountability-focused. Can you talk about how that kind of fits in the compensation plans? Like the previous team have alluded to test in certain markets [indiscernible] the compensation structure. Can you maybe just talk about how the 2 relate and kind of how you look at that going forward?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, obviously, critical. We want to make sure that once we've got alignment to the strategy and we pick the right metrics to drive I guess that strategy, that the incentive systems are directly lined up against those. So that flies up and down the organi
componenttext: Yes, obviously, critical. We want to make sure that once we've got alignment to the strategy and we pick the right metrics to drive I guess that strategy, that the incentive systems are directly lined up against those. So that flies up and down the organization, right, Chris? We look at the senior executive team and whether those metrics are lined up to deliver, so that the incentives are lined up to deliver metrics right down to the front like organization. And we want to make sure that people are incented to go after the metrics that matter the most. And I think in the past, we did shift around a little bit in terms of what we challenged our large field organization to do and we want to get really grounded on a very small limited set of metrics for them to focus against and we'll incent them and we'll reward them for achieving those goals.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Michael Lasser with UBS.
componenttext: The next question is from Michael Lasser with UBS.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: So you outlined several factors that are going to pressure your profitability in the back half. And it [indiscernible] like sales remains pretty sluggish. So how should we think about your margins in the third quarter and the fourth quarter, particularly
componenttext: So you outlined several factors that are going to pressure your profitability in the back half. And it [indiscernible] like sales remains pretty sluggish. So how should we think about your margins in the third quarter and the fourth quarter, particularly in the last quarter of the year where you're going to be facing a very easy comparison? So are your margins going to be down year-over-year in both of those quarters?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Hey Michael, good to talk to you. NO, I think Tom laid it out well. Our focus in the back half is improving our service and our availability and getting that top line going. So I'd say there are 3 drivers at how we're thinking about the back half. We're n
componenttext: Hey Michael, good to talk to you. NO, I think Tom laid it out well. Our focus in the back half is improving our service and our availability and getting that top line going. So I'd say there are 3 drivers at how we're thinking about the back half. We're not giving an EPS annual outlook, but I did give you a little bit of context that would be helpful to how we're thinking about the back half of the year financially. Based on that down 3 to down 5 for the full year, we are going to continue to see SG&A and supply chain deleverage. Our model needs sales, and with an 80% roughly fixed cost model you just deleverage, that will be the largest driver of our operating margins in the back half. Second of all, we're going to make investments in service and availability that Tom talked about earlier. And then third is, we've got -- as you could see our inventory in the second quarter was up 7.3%, we are planning on our inventory being up low-single digits by the end of the year. There are some capitalized supply chain cost that will be a headwind as we go into the back half of the year. So those will be the 3 drivers. So yes, we would anticipate some strain on our margins, but that's all I'm going to say because we're not giving an EPS annual outlook.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Understood. Tom, now that you've had time to digest and diagnose the company, how long do you think it's going to take to generate a positive comp?
componenttext: Understood. Tom, now that you've had time to digest and diagnose the company, how long do you think it's going to take to generate a positive comp?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we're obviously not giving specifics beyond the balance of the year on the call, but I'm pretty optimistic that we can accelerate our sales going forward. I think the idea of really getting this entire organization focused on the customer, Michael,
componenttext: Well, we're obviously not giving specifics beyond the balance of the year on the call, but I'm pretty optimistic that we can accelerate our sales going forward. I think the idea of really getting this entire organization focused on the customer, Michael, is going to bounce at us. I can feel it. When I go out to the field, people want to win. We got great leaders that run our field organization the general managers want to drive the top line. They're very competitive. They just need the tools to go out there and get it and we have to enable that by looking carefully at our supply chain and triggering out how to do a better job, getting them the part they need when the customer wants it. So we're optimistic about this, very optimistic we can drive the top line. I can't give you a specific time line but we are making a lot of progress on the things that need to be done in order to accelerate growth.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Tom, maybe another way just to ask you is if you go back to the second quarter, in your mind, do you have a sense for how much of the comp decline or the underperformance was due to self-inflicted factors and how much was due to weakness in the market, pa
componenttext: Tom, maybe another way just to ask you is if you go back to the second quarter, in your mind, do you have a sense for how much of the comp decline or the underperformance was due to self-inflicted factors and how much was due to weakness in the market, particularly in the geographies that Advance Auto is levered to?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think if you look at our comparative performance, you would say the majority of it is self-inflicted, right, I mean just does look at the relative performance. I mean our goal is to perform above the top performers in the industry. So for us to do it to
componenttext: I think if you look at our comparative performance, you would say the majority of it is self-inflicted, right, I mean just does look at the relative performance. I mean our goal is to perform above the top performers in the industry. So for us to do it to achieve that, that is a significant gap. There was some geographic softness which have been called out by others. But relatively speaking, it's a small percentage of our opportunity. As we start to improve on some of the basic metrics that are important to execute against in the marketplace, we can grow significantly.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Ben Bienvenu with Stephens Inc.
componenttext: The next question is from Ben Bienvenu with Stephens Inc.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: You've talked a lot about improving availability and service levels. I'm curious as you look across the industry and in places where you're winning back share, is it purely on account of availability and service levels? Or maybe said other way, given the
componenttext: You've talked a lot about improving availability and service levels. I'm curious as you look across the industry and in places where you're winning back share, is it purely on account of availability and service levels? Or maybe said other way, given the level of service some of your peers, do you think that's solely enough to win back share that you've lost? Or do you see it more as a story of winning share from the consolidation of the industry and independent operators in the space?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, Ben, we did a pretty deep dive, as I mentioned in the prepared remarks, on what matters most to our customers, whether that's on the commercial side or on the retail side, and we got a pretty clear idea of the table stakes that matter the most. We'v
componenttext: Well, Ben, we did a pretty deep dive, as I mentioned in the prepared remarks, on what matters most to our customers, whether that's on the commercial side or on the retail side, and we got a pretty clear idea of the table stakes that matter the most. We've got an idea on the specific jobs in terms of where we can make a difference. So it is obviously not as simple as I'm describing it. But getting the right place is really, really foundational to success. And we have not done as good a job on that as some of our competitors candidly, and we've got to elevate our game there. So we're very focused on solutions that will enable us to do that and we've got some very, very promising pilots that we're testing out there in the marketplace that are giving us confidence that going forward, we can provide solutions that are as good as or better than our competition out there in the marketplace.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Understood. And then looking at the balance sheet a bit, AP to inventory ratio ticking down a little bit. I'd be curious to get your sense of in the backdrop of some of the changes that you're making, what do you expect the opportunity to look like there?
componenttext: Understood. And then looking at the balance sheet a bit, AP to inventory ratio ticking down a little bit. I'd be curious to get your sense of in the backdrop of some of the changes that you're making, what do you expect the opportunity to look like there? And can we think about that as another lever to pull to improve shareholder returns over time?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, absolutely. And Tom talked about it. I mean improving our working capital is another part opportunity and it's going to be a byproduct of our improved performance. And I would say there's 2 big drivers. One, Tom's talked at length about it, the need
componenttext: Yes, absolutely. And Tom talked about it. I mean improving our working capital is another part opportunity and it's going to be a byproduct of our improved performance. And I would say there's 2 big drivers. One, Tom's talked at length about it, the need to improve our performance and that will drive free cash flow and that'll drive, obviously, an ability to return back to shareholders. The second biggest opportunity we have and the opportunity that drove the AP ratio a little bit lower than last year was our inventory management, and there is a very large focus around that. Tom talked about it in his remarks. We're going to see in the back half some of that movement happen as we move through the transitional inventory, particularly in our CARQUEST brand of stores, first, the consolidations we've done on the closed stores. Obviously, at our AAP branded stores, there are going to be some improvements there. We're making investments in availability and we've got some new stores, but also we're getting more productive with our inventory and we're looking at areas that we can get better in AAP. And then the third one is WORLDPAC. One of the drivers of our 7 3 increase was WORLDPAC and WORLDPAC's inventory growth was up about 15% and the reason is we've got a new Dallas DC for WORLDPAC. So what we anticipate is inventory management is going to be a big driver of the opportunity to improve the free cash flow and as you return it and obviously the return back to shareholders.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Seth Basham with Wedbush Securities.
componenttext: The next question is from Seth Basham with Wedbush Securities.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: My first question is just if you could give any more detail on the relative performance in terms of basis points gap between the Northeast and Great Lakes versus the rest of the chain.
componenttext: My first question is just if you could give any more detail on the relative performance in terms of basis points gap between the Northeast and Great Lakes versus the rest of the chain.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Seth, we had a big gap. There's no question about that. And I mentioned the challenges that we had in some of those distribution centers up there that really hurt our business in the short term that we've corrected. So the gap is pretty sizable. I'm not g
componenttext: Seth, we had a big gap. There's no question about that. And I mentioned the challenges that we had in some of those distribution centers up there that really hurt our business in the short term that we've corrected. So the gap is pretty sizable. I'm not going to give you specific numbers but it was a pretty sizable gap in the quarter and I'm confident that changes that we've just initiated. In fact, we've just reviewed the performance in the first-week yesterday. We're confident that we're going to get make some big progress up there.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, that's helpful. And then secondly, you're making a bunch of changes on investments here you're talking about. As you look forward to 2017, obviously, without providing any guidance, would you expect your operating margins to rise versus 2016? Or do
componenttext: Okay, that's helpful. And then secondly, you're making a bunch of changes on investments here you're talking about. As you look forward to 2017, obviously, without providing any guidance, would you expect your operating margins to rise versus 2016? Or do you think there will be investments that will offset those improvements?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, obviously, over time, the margin expansion opportunity is massive here. There's no question about that. I haven't talked in the Q&A much about the productivity agenda, but I'm really excited about the work we're doing on productivity. We're going th
componenttext: Well, obviously, over time, the margin expansion opportunity is massive here. There's no question about that. I haven't talked in the Q&A much about the productivity agenda, but I'm really excited about the work we're doing on productivity. We're going throughout our entire organization bucketing the cost the way that I feel we need to in order to get at the discrete real productivity opportunity, sustainable multi-year productivity opportunities that are out there. We're leading that throughout each function. We've got a cost base that we've laid out. We've got targets for distribution centers, distribution centers to stores, inside the stores, stores to customers. We're very focused on zero-based budgeting. All of those things will give us sustainable margin expansion opportunities and also enable us to invest back in growth. So there's little doubt in my mind that we'll expand margins over time. I think it's early for me to say whether that will happen in 2017. We should be in a position to talk to you about that sometime in November once we finished our strategic planning process and we've sequenced our investment profiles and got ready for all of those trade-offs, right, that need to be made between top line growth and productivity.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Scott Ciccarelli with RBC Capital Markets.
componenttext: The next question is from Scott Ciccarelli with RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: I know we've had a bunch of questions around this, but when you do think about that margin expansion opportunity, I think you just used the work massive through productivity improvements, et cetera, but Tom you've also mentioned investments need to be mad
componenttext: I know we've had a bunch of questions around this, but when you do think about that margin expansion opportunity, I think you just used the work massive through productivity improvements, et cetera, but Tom you've also mentioned investments need to be made. So when you think about kind of 2017 versus 2016, can you provide some color on how you guys are thinking about the margin profile just, call it, 1 or 2 years out, like what the general cadence is going to be even if it's not specific numbers.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. First of all, Scott, when we think about constructing the productivity pipeline that I just described, we obviously want more than just necessary to expand margins. So we're targeting to have enough cost take-out that we can invest back and expand m
componenttext: Sure. First of all, Scott, when we think about constructing the productivity pipeline that I just described, we obviously want more than just necessary to expand margins. So we're targeting to have enough cost take-out that we can invest back and expand margins at the same time. So we have to self-fund our growth. And given the first half we have had on this, we'll be in a good position to do that in 2017. The question is how much investment is going to be required to stimulate the top line in 2017, but over time, we've done the 5-year, there's no question that we can build this business with sustainable top line growth and expand margins at the same time.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, and that's helpful. And then one of the things I think you mentioned on the last call was you are out meeting with a lot of the vendors, some of the vendors in the community. Can you share the general feedback that you've had from the vendors that A
componenttext: Okay, and that's helpful. And then one of the things I think you mentioned on the last call was you are out meeting with a lot of the vendors, some of the vendors in the community. Can you share the general feedback that you've had from the vendors that Advance tries to kind of our rework how they historically work with the vendor community?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. We've had really good discussions with our vendor partners. they're central to our success over the long term. We have several meetings with them. We have several meetings coming up with them. They were all in. They really want to be part of the gro
componenttext: Sure. We've had really good discussions with our vendor partners. they're central to our success over the long term. We have several meetings with them. We have several meetings coming up with them. They were all in. They really want to be part of the growth story within the industry. I mean I think from their standpoint, they look at us as, perhaps, the biggest growth opportunity they have. So we're spending a lot of time with our vendors and they're working collaboratively with us on solutions that can help differentiate us in the marketplace.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Matt McClintock with Barclays.
componenttext: The next question is from Matt McClintock with Barclays.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Tom, earlier you said -- you talked about consolidations. You mentioned historically that it hit the goals and you've reduced that plan going forward. Have you ever given the size of that reduction? And just as a second question on that, previously, you h
componenttext: Tom, earlier you said -- you talked about consolidations. You mentioned historically that it hit the goals and you've reduced that plan going forward. Have you ever given the size of that reduction? And just as a second question on that, previously, you have decided to consolidate some stores. What does that mean about the profitability profile of the stores now that you're not going to consolidate them?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, in terms of the -- versus what we originally planned, I think we ended up -- roughly 2/3 is where we ended up in terms of the go-forward strategy in terms of what we originally planned x number of stores and we're probably about [ph] 2/3 of that. So
componenttext: Well, in terms of the -- versus what we originally planned, I think we ended up -- roughly 2/3 is where we ended up in terms of the go-forward strategy in terms of what we originally planned x number of stores and we're probably about [ph] 2/3 of that. So essentially, we've stepped back and looked at the performance. And candidly, as we went through the process, the first stores we did were stronger than the more recent ones. I mean that's the reality of it. I mean you cannot go to the ones that are, let's say, the lowest hanging fruit from the beginning. And then as you move along, the business case, the economic case that isn't as attractive -- and we're giving back significant amount of market share, the trade of on profitability just isn't worth it over the long term. So I think that's where we ended up.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Kate McShane with Citi Research.
componenttext: The next question is from Kate McShane with Citi Research.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Well, first of all, what it cost us in the source impacted, I'm not going to give you a specific number, Chris, but it was a significant number. We moved rapidly. We challenge our team to get something done that was very difficult for them to do. And
componenttext: Yes. Well, first of all, what it cost us in the source impacted, I'm not going to give you a specific number, Chris, but it was a significant number. We moved rapidly. We challenge our team to get something done that was very difficult for them to do. And in the end, I mean I spent a lot of time in those DCs in the marketplace with those general managers and they dealt with the pretty tough set of circumstances for a period of time. So our ability to correct that for them which, as I mentioned earlier, we've just done, is a welcome change and we just had a great discussion about it yesterday. I'm very excited about how the team feels about it because we did respond to something that was important to them. Can you repeat your second question again? I want to make sure I understand it.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. It's on the consolidation side. What are you seeing on the sales trends versus consolidated stores in sort of the existing markets? And for the stores that were converted, I guess what kind of sales retention are you seeing in the stores?
componenttext: Yes. It's on the consolidation side. What are you seeing on the sales trends versus consolidated stores in sort of the existing markets? And for the stores that were converted, I guess what kind of sales retention are you seeing in the stores?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, the converted stores, we're pretty excited about. I mean we've seen some nice growth on the conversions, and in fact, the goal is we've actually increased. The consolidation stores, we had a percentage of sales that we want to retain going into it. W
componenttext: Yes, the converted stores, we're pretty excited about. I mean we've seen some nice growth on the conversions, and in fact, the goal is we've actually increased. The consolidation stores, we had a percentage of sales that we want to retain going into it. We started to slip below that percentage and that's why we pulled back on it.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay and just one quick one. In the past, you've mentioned some impact to retaining talent as a result of emerging and other factors. Has that improved in recent months? And I guess how are you approaching the retention of talent?
componenttext: Okay and just one quick one. In the past, you've mentioned some impact to retaining talent as a result of emerging and other factors. Has that improved in recent months? And I guess how are you approaching the retention of talent?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. We are all over retaining our top talent. There's nothing more important in this company than the frontline organizations that faces our customers every single day out there in the marketplace, and I'm really proud the way our team has rallied agains
componenttext: Yes. We are all over retaining our top talent. There's nothing more important in this company than the frontline organizations that faces our customers every single day out there in the marketplace, and I'm really proud the way our team has rallied against this issue. I mean a couple of months ago, we declared a crisis in this area and we've got very focused on how are we going to retain our general managers, our commercial Parts Pros, our commercial account managers out there in the field, and we've actually started to see positive performance year-on-year on retention. So you can count on us to be very focused on our frontline organization. It's incredibly important for our business [indiscernible] to faces our customers day in and day out and we're going to do everything we can to enable them to succeed in the marketplace and that includes giving them the tools, the training, the technology and the incentives to go out and win in the market.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Mike Baker with Deutsche Bank.
componenttext: The next question is from Mike Baker with Deutsche Bank.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: So in some of your customer survey work I'm wondering, so obviously, availability, most important. How important is price to customers? And then can you square the answer there with some of the investments you said you're making in the fourth quarter. How
componenttext: So in some of your customer survey work I'm wondering, so obviously, availability, most important. How important is price to customers? And then can you square the answer there with some of the investments you said you're making in the fourth quarter. How much of that -- and even into 2017, how much of that investment is going to be in price to drive demand? And again, how does that relate to what the customers tell you they place the importance on price?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, it came up. I mean I'm not going to skirt that one, Mike. I mean value is important. You can't ignore value. At the same time, I think you've heard from others that it isn't the#1 thing that comes up. It's on the list but it's not in the top couple o
componenttext: Yes, it came up. I mean I'm not going to skirt that one, Mike. I mean value is important. You can't ignore value. At the same time, I think you've heard from others that it isn't the#1 thing that comes up. It's on the list but it's not in the top couple of things that are important for them. So we can't ignore it. And so we have to look and we just did this yesterday. We go category by category, part by part. We benchmark versus competition, we look for opportunities surgically, but we're not looking at some kind of broad-based pricing action as a company. The investments that we need to make are going to be made against the quality of our assortment, our fill rate, our order accuracy, the consistency of our delivery, our overall service proposition to the customer. That's what we're looking at making investments.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, that's helpful. Just as a follow-up to some of the other comments that you've made. So in the Great Lakes and the Northeast, you've changed some things around and thing seems to be getting better. My sense is you're not going to quantify that for us
componenttext: Okay, that's helpful. Just as a follow-up to some of the other comments that you've made. So in the Great Lakes and the Northeast, you've changed some things around and thing seems to be getting better. My sense is you're not going to quantify that for us, but is there any way that dimensionalize it as things come from negative comps to positive comps or anything along those lines where we've made those improvements? I think sort of point to what the possible could be over the coming quarters.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, that would be quantifying it, I think, but I'll try to answer that. I mean we're definitely seeing improvement, okay? And based on where we were, I think we should see a pretty substantial improvement in those stores that were impacted. Keep in mind
componenttext: Well, that would be quantifying it, I think, but I'll try to answer that. I mean we're definitely seeing improvement, okay? And based on where we were, I think we should see a pretty substantial improvement in those stores that were impacted. Keep in mind it's not a huge number of stores across our network. But in the stores that experience some of those difficulties, they should see a substantial improvement in their performance.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Greg Milledge with Evercore ISI.
componenttext: Our next question is from Greg Milledge with Evercore ISI.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's Mike for Greg. Just wanted to ask if I could. Can you talk about last quarter you guys have said $260 million to $280 million of CapEx. Can you just provide an update there? And then as we move forward the next few years, how are you all thinking abo
componenttext: It's Mike for Greg. Just wanted to ask if I could. Can you talk about last quarter you guys have said $260 million to $280 million of CapEx. Can you just provide an update there? And then as we move forward the next few years, how are you all thinking about what that number could become if you were to do all the different initiatives that you have potentially on tap?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes well first of all, Mike, we're right smack dab in the middle of our strategic planning process. We've had a couple of discussions with our board on this topic. We're continuing to narrow the list of priorities that need to be done, sequencing them app
componenttext: Yes well first of all, Mike, we're right smack dab in the middle of our strategic planning process. We've had a couple of discussions with our board on this topic. We're continuing to narrow the list of priorities that need to be done, sequencing them appropriately over the strategic horizon. CapEx is essentially an output of all of that work. So at the moment, we're really not in a position to say where we're going there. We're looking at multiple places to drive value for the corporation. That includes across supply chain, information technology, new store openings, geographic expansion. All of those things are on the table, but eventually, we got to narrow that list and come up with the most appropriate mix of growth-related capital, productivity-related capital, information technology, and we have not completed that yet. So the working hypothesis is kind of continuing with the number that you have. That's what we're working with at the moment, but there's more to come.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then if I could just follow up on -- for the quarter, can you provide any incremental color about traffic versus ticket split on the negative 4 and then also just store growth in square footage growth for the back half of the year? How sh
componenttext: Okay, great. And then if I could just follow up on -- for the quarter, can you provide any incremental color about traffic versus ticket split on the negative 4 and then also just store growth in square footage growth for the back half of the year? How should we think about consolidations and closures versus new openings?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, first of all, I mean, you have to split out DIY commercial. But broadly, more of a traffic issue than a ticket issue at the moment. And on store growth in the back half, we'll have to get back to you on that one. I don't have that right off the top
componenttext: Well, first of all, I mean, you have to split out DIY commercial. But broadly, more of a traffic issue than a ticket issue at the moment. And on store growth in the back half, we'll have to get back to you on that one. I don't have that right off the top of my head.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Dan Wewer with Raymond James.
componenttext: The next question is from Dan Wewer with Raymond James.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Mike, you reminded us that you'll have higher capitalized supply chain costs in the fourth quarter as you begin to draw down your inventories. Will that headwind continue through the first 3 quarters of 2017 until you anniversary the inventory reduction?
componenttext: Mike, you reminded us that you'll have higher capitalized supply chain costs in the fourth quarter as you begin to draw down your inventories. Will that headwind continue through the first 3 quarters of 2017 until you anniversary the inventory reduction?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: No. Not necessarily, Dan. I mean it really depends because we haven't given the outlook for 2017. I mean the big driver, obviously, in the back half of the year is we're going to see a significant falloff. Typically, our inventory growth and bleed-down is
componenttext: No. Not necessarily, Dan. I mean it really depends because we haven't given the outlook for 2017. I mean the big driver, obviously, in the back half of the year is we're going to see a significant falloff. Typically, our inventory growth and bleed-down is a little bit smoother but with the moves we're making in the back half of the year, and again they're very plan full. But I can't say that because really our plan is to get -- a big driver of that is the sales. So as we start to position ourselves and when we give that outlook and how we're thinking about 2017, we'll be in a better position to give you a holistic picture because there's other things that impact that.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: I was just thinking about the unit accounting rules for inventory, that will be a headwind because you'd have fewer units but you're saying that may not be the case?
componenttext: I was just thinking about the unit accounting rules for inventory, that will be a headwind because you'd have fewer units but you're saying that may not be the case?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes that may not be the case. You're correct. I mean obviously, if you continue to bleed down inventory with lower sales, yes, that will be a headwind especially if your supply chain costs are increasing, but our plan is to get the top line going, get rid
componenttext: Yes that may not be the case. You're correct. I mean obviously, if you continue to bleed down inventory with lower sales, yes, that will be a headwind especially if your supply chain costs are increasing, but our plan is to get the top line going, get rid of some of this inventory that's transitional, and then obviously, we're going to be buying inventory. And as Tom said, we're going to be improving the efficiency of our supply chain, so there's a lot of moving pieces there.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Tom, I want to follow up with you on the consolidations. So what happens going forward if there's a CARQUEST, a company-owned CARQUEST store and an Advance store in the same market but you decide not to go down the consolidation path? Are you thinking abo
componenttext: Tom, I want to follow up with you on the consolidations. So what happens going forward if there's a CARQUEST, a company-owned CARQUEST store and an Advance store in the same market but you decide not to go down the consolidation path? Are you thinking about a dual branding strategy in that same market? And the reason I am asking because I saw the original plan was to only use the CARQUEST brand in the independently operated locations.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, we're still not complete in our assessment of that, Dan. Obviously, the independents, which are a critical part of our business and one that potentially we see further opportunity to grow going forward, we've got a great group of independent operator
componenttext: Yes, we're still not complete in our assessment of that, Dan. Obviously, the independents, which are a critical part of our business and one that potentially we see further opportunity to grow going forward, we've got a great group of independent operators out there who operate under the CARQUEST brand that we want to continue to drive growth with. That's going to be central to our strategy but we haven't aligned on the role of the 2 different brands as we go forward. We got some markets where it's exclusively CARQUEST. As you know, we got others where it's exclusively Advance. And where we have the 2 of them, we do believe that we can have them coexist in the same market. We just got to figure out how those 2 banners can operate in a way that are incremental and play a different role. And that's where a lot of the work that we've done on demand and the specific job that are relevant our customers. We can focus CARQUEST on a certain part of the business. We can focus Advance on another part of the business and make sure that it's incremental for the company. That's the trick in terms of making sure that they work together.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: You also noted that you're right in the middle of the strategic planning process that you also had multiple pilots for our supply chain changes that you're testing as well. How long do those pilots need to continue before you can finalize your strategic p
componenttext: You also noted that you're right in the middle of the strategic planning process that you also had multiple pilots for our supply chain changes that you're testing as well. How long do those pilots need to continue before you can finalize your strategic plan? I think you mentioned November but I was thinking it will take longer than that to analyze the results.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: We're going to move fast. We've got the pilots in flight as we speak. We do have phases to the pilots and we're working against those phases but we're obviously going to take the learnings from the pilots and the ones that can be applied immediately and l
componenttext: We're going to move fast. We've got the pilots in flight as we speak. We do have phases to the pilots and we're working against those phases but we're obviously going to take the learnings from the pilots and the ones that can be applied immediately and leverage those. Other aspects are going to take longer but the pilots are really exciting for us. I mean they're designed to at the same time provide greater availability for our customers, improve the quality of the assortment and make sure that we're delivering parts faster and more consistently to our customers while we're taking cost out of our supply chain and reducing inventory. So it has really the triple benefit of doing all 3. We're measuring against a very, very detailed dashboard that looks at all of those metrics in tandem and we're iterating as we go. But the early results are very good. But I feel that we can move faster than perhaps you may have indicated. I won't be able to roll everything out at once I mean again given it's phased. Once we get past the first checkpoint, there's other things that we want to explore. But I guess what I'm saying is you go through the first phase of a pilot, we can roll that -- those aspects that make sense into the marketplace and then test base 2 as we go.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Would you ever be comfortable having one distribution facility supporting WORLDPAC, Advance and CARQUEST and perhaps AI as well?
componenttext: Would you ever be comfortable having one distribution facility supporting WORLDPAC, Advance and CARQUEST and perhaps AI as well?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, clearly, the move with Bob today is designed to really look horizontally across our organization, our commercial organization. Now I don't think that we're going to get to that particular dimension right out of the gate, but we're going to look at i
componenttext: Well, clearly, the move with Bob today is designed to really look horizontally across our organization, our commercial organization. Now I don't think that we're going to get to that particular dimension right out of the gate, but we're going to look at it. I mean clearly on the customer side, we've never had a holistic strategy between Advance and AI and WORLDPAC. We've had multiple organizations going out there selling to commercial customers and admittedly with different products. But as import vehicles are growing, private label is becoming increasingly important, which is Auto Parts International specialty. We do see an opportunity to look across and clearly leverage some of the capabilities more broadly. On the supply chain itself, I mean think there are elements of the supply chain where they could make sense. As an example, we have an Advance close by here the office that gets 8 deliveries a day from the WORLDPAC brand, and yet we're also delivering from the Advance store going to the WORLDPAC brand. So it's integrating the transportation management systems on those supply chains can help us reduce costs and be more efficient. And there's a many other things that Bob's going to look at so we're very excited about this change. Bob's a terrific leader. He's got -- they've built this online capability out there in WORLDPAC that is really as good as anybody's in the industry. And with the growth in online coming up in the future years, our intention is to leverage their online and e-commerce capabilities more broadly across Advance.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Bret Jordan with Jefferies.
componenttext: The next question is from Bret Jordan with Jefferies.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Quick question. I guess as you're talking about the IT in the pilot programs, have you stopped rewriting the APAC system and are sort of evaluating how you're going to consolidate the systems behind distribution? Or are you still sort of looking for one c
componenttext: Quick question. I guess as you're talking about the IT in the pilot programs, have you stopped rewriting the APAC system and are sort of evaluating how you're going to consolidate the systems behind distribution? Or are you still sort of looking for one common backbone to that? And I guess a piece of the same question, where are you on point of sale consolidation? And then the read-through, you talked about Northeastern and Midwestern supply chain problems in the quarter our those around the DCs that ran Red [indiscernible]? Or is that something different?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, first of all, on APAC, we just had a review on Friday. We're making some real good progress there. Our field Team Members, we've got several stores, Bret that are up and running in the pilot. With any change, when you're talking about change to your
componenttext: Well, first of all, on APAC, we just had a review on Friday. We're making some real good progress there. Our field Team Members, we've got several stores, Bret that are up and running in the pilot. With any change, when you're talking about change to your catalog and how people work every single day, it does take some time to make sure that it's absolutely performing at a level that our people love it, and we still got some work to do there. So the short answer on APAC is it's proceedings on the time line that we had, but we want to make sure when we roll it out that it's really driving our top line and the efficiency of our Team Members and we're continuing to refine how we approach the APAC's rollout because we want to make sure that it's absolutely [indiscernible] when we roll it out. We're continuing to work through the POS consolidation essentially that continues on, the time lines that we've talked about there. I don't know it was entirely Red Prairie related in the Northeast. It's a factor but it's not just Red Prairie. There's other distribution centers impacted that business that did not use Red Prairie.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then one follow-up question, you talked about some of the high-profile branded parts that have been taken out of the merchandise mix possibly coming back. Could you give us any color sort of where we are on sort of how you think about some of the bran
componenttext: And then one follow-up question, you talked about some of the high-profile branded parts that have been taken out of the merchandise mix possibly coming back. Could you give us any color sort of where we are on sort of how you think about some of the branded products that were important to commercial customers?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Charles and his team are doing a pretty thorough review of where we are on hard parts and how we benchmark versus our competition. For the most part, we feel pretty good about our assortment, but we are looking at some things that we actually got a meetin
componenttext: Charles and his team are doing a pretty thorough review of where we are on hard parts and how we benchmark versus our competition. For the most part, we feel pretty good about our assortment, but we are looking at some things that we actually got a meeting coming up next week on this topic. So there's nothing specific to report right now, Bret, but we are going to look very closely on our hard part of assortment because we got to have something that is competitive across every single category.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Carolina Jolly with Gabelli.
componenttext: The next question is from Carolina Jolly with Gabelli.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: I guess in regards to WORLDPAC. I know a couple of quarters ago, you mentioned some cannibalization in comps when there are new branches or DCs. Is there any more that? Or do you have any more details relative WORLDPAC comps year-over-year or any decelera
componenttext: I guess in regards to WORLDPAC. I know a couple of quarters ago, you mentioned some cannibalization in comps when there are new branches or DCs. Is there any more that? Or do you have any more details relative WORLDPAC comps year-over-year or any deceleration or acceleration?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Just to clarify, when you say cannibalization, what are you referring to, sorry?
componenttext: Just to clarify, when you say cannibalization, what are you referring to, sorry?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: So when they open some of the new branches initially, I think there was a mention that there's some cannibalization from branch to  branch.
componenttext: So when they open some of the new branches initially, I think there was a mention that there's some cannibalization from branch to  branch.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Branch inside WORLDPAC, yes, okay.
componenttext: Branch inside WORLDPAC, yes, okay.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Let me hit that. So first of all, at the highest level, WORLDPAC had continued to grow their business. And I think we mentioned it in our remarks they will end up bright spots in the quarter for us, so they continue to grow. And then in terms of cannibali
componenttext: Let me hit that. So first of all, at the highest level, WORLDPAC had continued to grow their business. And I think we mentioned it in our remarks they will end up bright spots in the quarter for us, so they continue to grow. And then in terms of cannibalization, I think it's a little bit different for a commercial-only business when they open up. Because almost 90% of their business is controlled by a systems, meaning their customers order online, when they actually open another branch, they actually move those customers that were serviced out of one branch and they move them to another branch. So they actually -- so cannibalization is actually -- they're actually changing their systems, so we don't view that as a bad thing. What typically happens is when they open up a new branch, that was close to where another branch was, they see cannibalization of the original branch because they deliberately move the customers because they can give them better service by servicing them out of the new branch. And then what happens is both branches grown. So the cannibalization, if you look at their total growth and I think that's a better way to view the WORLDPAC business, their total business is growing as they're opening up new branches. And that cannibalization that they see in the original branch, that just grows back, the businesses grow back and it actually grows back strong in both branches.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: And just to make sure I understood what you said initially, did you mention or were you able to say if there was some acceleration in the WORLDPAC growth?
componenttext: And just to make sure I understood what you said initially, did you mention or were you able to say if there was some acceleration in the WORLDPAC growth?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: I didn't say acceleration but they had another -- they were one of the bright spots for us in the second quarter and their top line grew over last year.
componenttext: I didn't say acceleration but they had another -- they were one of the bright spots for us in the second quarter and their top line grew over last year.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our final question today comes from Craig Kennison with the beard.
componenttext: Our final question today comes from Craig Kennison with the beard.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Tom, you opened 3 super hubs in Atlanta in June. Is that at all representative of the type of DC investment you want to make on a national basis?
componenttext: Tom, you opened 3 super hubs in Atlanta in June. Is that at all representative of the type of DC investment you want to make on a national basis?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, Craig, again, we're stepping back on the supply chain, right? I mean we have a number of things that were in flight before I got here. But we are really looking carefully at how to transform our supply chain and future fit that structure for the mar
componenttext: Well, Craig, again, we're stepping back on the supply chain, right? I mean we have a number of things that were in flight before I got here. But we are really looking carefully at how to transform our supply chain and future fit that structure for the marketplace that we see is going to happen in the future. And I think the things that we have done, there'll be many things that we incorporate into that overall growth strategy. Some of them we won't. So it's just a question of is Atlanta what we're going to do. The answer is I don't know yet because we're having stepped back on the whole strategy that we've had because it hasn't produced the kind of results that we desire to have. There will be elements of things that we've done that we'll incorporate in, but we are testing some new and very different approaches to how we service our customers and efficiently get product to the marketplace. So aspects of it, yes. Specifically Atlanta, I don't know yet. I'm not sure. We're going to have that laid out in more detail as we get into November.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then with respect to the deep dive survey you mentioned, do you have any sense of how often your customer that's not choosing Advance today, how often that customer is choosing a national competitor that may be hard to displace versus a smaller compet
componenttext: And then with respect to the deep dive survey you mentioned, do you have any sense of how often your customer that's not choosing Advance today, how often that customer is choosing a national competitor that may be hard to displace versus a smaller competitor over which you would seem to have a scale advantage if your service levels are improved?

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, the answer to that question is yes, we do.
componenttext: Yes, the answer to that question is yes, we do.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: At this time, there are no further questions. I will turn the call back to Tom Greco for any final comments.
componenttext: At this time, there are no further questions. I will turn the call back to Tom Greco for any final comments.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Well, thank you, everyone, for joining us. Q2 was a difficult quarter for sure, but we do know the issues. I want to reinforce that the issues are absolutely fixable. There's no structural impediments to us addressing those issues. I feel great abou
componenttext: Okay. Well, thank you, everyone, for joining us. Q2 was a difficult quarter for sure, but we do know the issues. I want to reinforce that the issues are absolutely fixable. There's no structural impediments to us addressing those issues. I feel great about the progress that we're making and I couldn't be more excited about our future. You can count on us to dramatically elevate our focus on the customer and the top line to transform our supply chain for the future. We're going to dial up the intensity against our execution and we'll have a robust productivity pipeline. The board and the leadership team are aligned and prepared to take decisive actions and really create the value we need for shareholders over time and we're eager to get back to work and look forward to sharing our progress with you later in the year. So thanks for joining the call and this concludes the call for today.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
componenttextpreview: And that concludes our call today. You may now disconnect. Thank you for joining us.
componenttext: And that concludes our call today. You may now disconnect. Thank you for joining us.

headline: Advance Auto Parts Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 16, 2016
